beastly abuse slouthfull life gaue great oportunitie arbaces valiant captaine medes man magnanimitie generall medium consulting belochus lieutenant babylon man great experience arbaces belochus agreed seeing occasion offered ioyne force together sardanapalus done two great ouerthrowes giuen last ouerthrow assyrian arbaces arbaces almost slaine people scattered fled sardanapalus yet strong thirde time hee found assyrian full wine armie sleepie drunkennesse according wonted maners arbaces againe night force entred vnto tentes found bed full surphets slewe heapes sardanapalus fled citie niniue lieutenant slaine hee besieged niniue people forsooke went enemy perceiuing great danger sent three sonnes two daughter paphlagonia friend cottus great treasure auoyd present perill full desperation made owne graue gorgeous sumptuous high maner sardapalus death building hee brought 150 bed made pure golde many table likewise golde much feasting banqueting queenes concubine many deare friend midest pleasure commaunded fire put pallace meane pile wood made graue ended life empire together fire escape enemy thus ended monarchie assyria one thousand two hundreth fourtie yeeres continuance hee receiued amasis hand refused giue owne daughter mariage king persia deceiued daughter apries called nytetis onely left aliue stocke apries cambyses maried supposing bee king amasis herodot lib 3 daughter vntill apries daughter opened whole matter affirming vnto king howe amasis betrayed father king master reason obteined kingdome egypt also shee reuealed howe disdained giue owne daughter tooke vp left desolate comfortlesse willed mee cambyses faine selfe bee daughter floutes scoffes amasis kindled wrath cambyses come armes egypt came amasis died notwithstanding conquered sonne psammenitus possessed kingdome egypt hee went memphis vnto sai satisfie wrath vpon amasis though buried yet hee caused carcas brought cōmaunded first whipt crueltie cambyses scourged thrust dagger bodkin haled lugged citie sai contempt might inuented last caused burned maner egyptian suppose fire liuing creature fire deuoureth thing last deuoureth selfe thus olde auncient king egypt continued thousand melancth li •… 2 chron two hundred yeeres conquered nation though king assyria chaldea florished chiefely often assaulted yet neuer lost proper name king called pharaos vntill cambyses time continued vnder persian hundred thirtie fiue yeeres reuoulted diodo lib 2 vnder darius nothus kept vntill many sharpe battailes againe ochus vanquished vsed egypt great crueltie time tomiris queene massegets tarquinius superbus last king romanes reigned rome romanes lost king egyptian lost kingdome one time cambyses time hindred building temple meanes samaritanes euer enuied ierusalem thus crueltie later king egypt melancth lib 4 eight thirtie yeeres vnder persian persian vanquished monarchie taken persia macedonia alexander great egyptian willingly yeelded themselues alexander second conquerour hee vsed great clemencie permitting haue former liberty lawes appointed ouer certaine magistrate grecian called nomarchas ouer two superuisors called episcopi see none aforesaid magistrate claime dignitie set downe alexander table romanes afterward kept vsing order time alexander written great alexander yeerely tribute paide vnto life summe sixe thousande melancth lib 2 chron talent plutarch life agesilaus speaketh king named tachus egypt agesilaus came sparta nectanabus nephew king tachus one chiefe captaines rebelled king chosen egyptian king desired aide agesilaus ioyned olde affaire nectanabus good successe hee quietly stablished kingdome meanes agesilaus king sparta whō agesilaus nectanabus gaue two hundred thirtie talent siluer readie money defray charge souldiers thus nectanabus reigned quietly egypt though vnder darius last king persia mezabes gouerned egypt yeelded hand alexander kingdome egypt assoone hee heard master king darius slaine al persia subdued alexander heard possessed egypt without warres yeelded state egypt time alexander great vnto iulius diodo lib 18 caesar monarchie grecian vnto romanes two hundred eightie two yeeres death alexander 12 cap 1 waxed insolent victorie entred syria strong hand brought syria vnder egypt hee went ierusalem plagued citizēs wasted spoiled brought diuers iudea captiues egypt king prophet daniel spake sent sonne demetrius young man 22 yeeres first time tooke charge general hand old souldier great alexander trained vp discipline warres alwaies demetrius put flight 5000 men slaine almost eight thousand taken citie gaza antigonus hearing howe sonne ouerthrowen said ptolomei ouerthrew beardles men said fight bearded men came passe demetrius put flight quiet requited last foile king egypt receiued ptolomei ouerthrowen demetrius like ouerthrow wherein demetrius victorie ptolomei army victorie put ptolomei al syria brought antigonus againe time seleucus whō antigonus driuen babylon came againe entred babylon cassander likewise fearing young hercules sonne iustine lib 15 alexander great nowe fourteene yeeres age macedonian fauoured father sake hee king macedonia therefore hee secretly commaunded hercules mother arsine murthered yet cassander tyranny cassander quiet vntill hee practised like murther olympia alexander mother roxana alexander wife antigonus sonne demetrius much enuied daughter king euergetes sister shoulde come king north make agreement daniel saide shoulde continue shee shoulde bee daniel cap 11 deliuered death budde rootes shall one stande vp named euergetes died antiochus streight againe sought inuade egypt vnderstanding ptolomei epiphanes sonne heire philopator young able resist ptolo epiphanes 5 king egypt great king hee entred phoenicia partes syria history assyria briefly runne ouer rest king ptolomey epiphanes raigned 24 yeeres hee died leauing two sonnes behinde elder called philometor philometor sixt king egypt yonger called phiscon elder brother raigned king egypt 35 yeeres vncle antiochus epiphanes subtile king vnder pretence loue care nephew became ouerseer tutour rather aspiring kingdome respecting king hee furnished egypt men armes hauing strongest townes egypt owne hand pelusium others king yet yong idle slow courage addicted filthie vice without respect himselfe kingdome fled brother phiscon alexandria besieged antiochus vntill popilius romane sent senator rome commaunde antiochus egypt without delay hee constrained obey though much harme departure egypt philometor hauing recouered kingdome hand romanes friend auoyde braules stablish himselfe strong egypt maried daughter cleopatra alexander obtained kingdome syria friendship continued long demetrius nicanor sonne demetrius vanquished alexander came syria got lathurus cyprus sent citizen ptolomais defend alexander king iuda hearing lathurus cōming left purpose raised siege returned ierusalem fearing great armie ptolomey thirtie thousande fielde citizen opening cause comming rome sought therein catoes counsell tolde catos saying rome finde rome vnsatiable egypt conuerted siluer would suffice magistrate rome saying cato ptolomey found bee true long rome hauing fully satisfied senator magistrate sent senator specially pompey one gabinius restored kingdome againe raigned thirtie yeeres ptolomey dionysius 12 king egypt succeeded sonne ptolomey dionysius vnto pompey great fled battaile pharsalia hoping haue helpe friendship shewed father heard pompey slaine king commaundement strabo lib 17 head sent caesar also iulius caesar came like sauce prepared caesar preuented ouerthrewe put flight flight king thinking escape caesar hand entred melancthon lib 2 cocke boate drowned amongst rest company kingdome egypt giuen caesar vnto cleopatra dionysius sister raigned vntil twelfth yeere augustus caesar time willingly died accompany louing friend marcus antonius shee last line ptolomeis last queene egypt cleopatra cleopatra egypt made gouerned like sort alexander great second conquerour caesar done like appointing officer magistrate chiefe ruler named nomarchas two ouerseers episcopi manethon tooke notice therefore iosephus taunted cōteyning within selfe diuers sundrie nation sage nomades massagetes amazones caspian hircanians solinus cap 60 61 many nation bordering vpon scythia dwelling within scythia particularly write thinke needlesse rather pomponius pomponius mela lib 3 mela solinus also strabo 11 booke doeth describe scythia nation dwelt scythia exquisite painfull men describing countreis townes riuers hilles maners nature therefore lest seeme fabulous diuers writer herein offend grecian specially neuer thought history worth reading vnlesse mingled vaine fable wil write warres antiquitie therein shal hardly escape fable talmudist difficult thing finde true beginning antiquity prophane history liuie saith vt rerum vetustas sine errore esse nequit scithians thought one ancientest nation world diuers great kingdomes tooke beroaldus lib 4 cap 5 first originall celte olde gaules called frenchman berosus affirmeth noah name berosus lib 2 ianus familie dwelt first scithia saga thence came chaldea dwelt senar time ianus cameses saturnus al time ianus vntil ninus prophane writer called golden world men liued without lawes thinges common plinie naturall history affirmeth persian called scithians saga great contention betweene plinie cap 17 scithians egyptian concerning ther antiquity iustine lib 2 historie whereof written trogus pompeius much disputation concluded scitharum gen semper antiquissima scithians soueraingtie ouer egpytians antiquitie egyptian excelled great monstrous building scithians exceeded sweete famous riuers 1 ister herodotus lib 2 2 tyre 3 hypanis 4 borysthenes 5 panticapes 6 hypacaris 7 gerrhus 8 tanais 9 moetin scithians rude slauish people without maners nourture excelled farre greekes great care diligence studied attaine knowledge vertue howe much scithians ignorant greekes much scithians scithians excelled greekes vertue hardinesse courage warres accompted amongst nation inuincible people worlde doubtfull iustine saith whether men woman scithia famous attempted stratageme megara fayning himselfe reuoulted traytour purpose hee came tell howe might take chiefe lady gentlewoman athens together would follow magarians easely beleeuing man folowed solon vnderstood hee appointed certaine young men woman apparel daunce shore side short dagger vnder clothes vntill enemy landed done enemy hauing sight young lady dauncing playing without man greedily leapt one vpon necke take faire bootie one escaped slaine meanes salamina gotten athenian neuerthelesse magarians sharpely bent recouer magarians ouerthrowen salamina againe meanes coulde athens still great wittes euer busie bickering quarreling neighbour athenian coulde better perswade tongue fight thucyd lib 1 sword solon wanne great honour glorie one oration hee made defence temple apollo solon subtiltie witte set order betwixt poore riche time fell againe athenian attica diuided olde trouble dissencions gouernment citie atica selfe diuided taking part best chiefest citizen others common people solon pacified sedition hee neither partaker riche oppression poore solon poore necessitie offence equitie vpright dealing well knowen athens therefore hee chosen gouernour common consent countrie attica reforme rigour lawes temper state cōmon weales first began take away al draco bloodie lawes sauing murder manslaughter draco lawes solon mitigated lawes draco kinde offence punished death aswell least fault greatest offence therefore called lex sanguine scripta solon erected councell areopagite councell citie athens yeerely choose gouernour draco time areopagite certeine iudges vpon life death called ephetes time areopagite solon established diuers lawes within citie plutarch solon athens appointed three kindes councels gouerne citie one aboue instituted lawes briefely recite made lawe lawes solon maintenance willes testament hee made acte planting setting tree acte made 1 lawe shoulde transport realme neither 2 corne fruite stranger sauing oyle hee ordeyned 3 law stranger free denizen within athens appointed lawe welles attica 4 drye soyle wanting spring riuers vsing onely welles 5 therefore hee ordeined within foure furlong 6 halfe myle come one well made lawe forbid ioynters dowry vse marchandize mariage neither shoulde buye husbande gayne thereby man woman shoulde marrie issue pleasure loue hee made lawe woman going abroade time shoulde goe walke appointing lawes solon concerning woman athēs time feasting sacrificing also appointed time mourning plucke woman disorder wilfull libertie nature seeke made lawes idle person solon care countrie labour charging councell areopagite enquire howe euery man liued within athens punish desert likewise made lawe clearing debt called 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 afterward man lende money vpon vsurie lawe made plut solon law raysed value money 73 drachmes pounde hundred drachmes solon made lawe forbid euill speach dead nowe solon made lawes many caused written table plutarch called axone aristotle called cyrbes kingdome persia nowe happened darius nothus bequething cyrus yonger sonne lydia ionia cyrus pleased whether hee mother mooued cyrus onely ioye mother selfe enflamed desire soueraigntie hee gathered artaxerxes himselfe wound giuen cyrus melanct lib 2 chron one hande afterwarde cyrus taken bound fetter golde time died mother earnestly entreated cyrus mother meanes let libertie great furie followed first purpose gathered farre greater cyrus second battel armie wherein tenne thousand grecian vvell strongly furnished came greece ayde cyrus short vaine cyrus slaine battell armie ouerthrowen yet iustine saith grecian iustine lib 4 valiantly stoode vnconquered wing battell stood warre doeth xenophon zenoph de exped cyri amplie entreate cyrus yonger himselfe brought vp cyrus actes xenophon wrote sixteene bookes eight discipline militarie eight xenophon cyrus warres athens againe tyrannie gouerned thrasibulus carelesse represse tyrant whome ismenias prince thebe secretly ayded sparta written historie herodot lib 1 time phaortes sixth king medes slaine siedge niniue assyrian companie dayes tullius hostilius al familie burned owne house thirtie fiue olympiad many great warres blooddy battels fell time philip ieconia friendes likewise daniel fellowes caried away captiue vnto babylon within ierusalem besieged made euen ground iewes caried captiues vnto chaldea againe ciaxeres daniel others named darius medus great warres thus assyrian tooke citie niniue reuenged death phaortes assyrian quite destroyed brought monarchie vnto medes warres ancus martius fourth king laide siege thebe tooke hearing lysimachus king thracia taken prisoner barbarous nation hee went armie inuade thracia skant thracia lysimachus came home beside hearing pyrrhus forraged thessalia pyrrhus entred alreadie streightes thermopile demetrius constreined leaue thracia also thebe returne pyrrhus pyrrhus funct lib 3 comment sought demetrius armie giue battell demetrius sought also pyrrhus yet mist time demetrius lieutenant named pantarchus strong man great courage gaue pyrrhus battell victorie fell pyrrhus onely king imitated alexander great men report like courage prowesse victorie pyrrhus hee againe inuaded macedonia aduertised demetrius sicke iourney pyrrhus came farre citie edissa without resistance yet pyrrhus driuen macedonia time force demetrius wanting leasure fight pyrrhus hauing diod lib 17 many warres hand beside concluded peace pyrrhus demetrius troubled diuers wayes lysimachus king thracia inuaded high countrie macedon next vnto thracia ptolomei king egypt entred armie greece pyrrhus though peace concluded yet stept lysimachus entised macedonian partly faire meanes partly flatterie forsake demetrius meanes macedonia diuided betweene pyrrhus lysimachus pyrrhus proclaimed king macedonia chased demetrius pyrrhus reigned macedonia seuen moneths againe lysimachus made warre pyrrhus many battels lysimachus gote victorie reigned king macedonia seuen yeeres iustine praiseth lysimachus iustine lib 15 rarest man time valiant wise great philosopher noble house borne macedonia nowe become king written lysimachus slue lyon praise lysimachus owne hand leaue king macedonia returne demetrius three yeeres beene tossed curtius lib 8 extreme hard fortune nowe recouering kingdome againe hee leuied great armie one hundred thousand footemen twelue thousand horseman demetrius armie gotten fiue hundred shippes together part hauen piraeus part corinth part citie chalcis part citie pella enemy hearing newes meane three king seleucus ptolome lysimachus ioyned themselues together demetrius beside sent pyrrhus poore demetrius miserie princely happinesse funct lib 3 coment ouerthrowen armie forsooke himselfe yeelded vnto seleucus wife named phila griefe poysoned selfe kept prisoner syria seleucus demetrius turned captiuitie pleasure vnto dying day hee reigned sixe yeeres dyed cherronesus leauing behinde wife phila two child antigonus stratonice two sonnes named demetrius shall heare hereafter plutarch iustine plutarch demetr demetrius left two name behind ruffinus affirme posteritie demetrius succeeded king macedonia vntill last king named perseus time also died ptolomei lagi king egypt great fame report nowe lysimachus reigned macedonia vsing tyrannie practising crueltie owne subiects reuoulted fledde seleucus warre grewe betweene lysimacus lysimachus lost hee wanne fifteene child life also seleucus last battell fought amongst alexander successours seleucus long liued within seuen moneths diod lib 17 18 ptolomei citie argo alci •… neus brought pyrrhus head antigonus great king many victory ouer king slaine woman hand throwing tyle stone king antiochus sawe pyrrhus head throwen sonne contempt hee layed staffe sonnes backe calling cruell murtherer vnnaturall barbarous beast turning eye sight thereof weapt remembring demetrius hard fortune father also miserie ende first antigonus graundfather honourably caused head body burned ash burned thus thestate prince changed sometime height good lucke instine lib 25 fauour sometime forsaken owne friend antigonus hauing great victorie pyrrhus vsed clemencie towardes pyrrhus sonne named helenus sent vnto plutarch pirrho realme epirus honourable conuoye seasing pyrrhus campe armie vsed friendes courteously receiued many pyrrhus souldiers preferred thus pyrrhus helde three king lysimachus demetrius antigonus beside magnanimitie prowesse shewed illyrian cicilians carthagineans stoute romanes yet neuer conquered hanibals word pyrrhus pyrrhus preferred arsinoes beautie hee fell desire mother daughter demetrius proud insolent young king giuing great cause demetrius beronice young ladie hate little esteeming folowed fancie winne arsinoe well knowen armie three troupe himselfe went one three philip lost two thousand souldiers macedonian fled romanes spoiled campe tooke found tent titus aduertisement philip fledde thessalia consul great modestie philip fledde forbeare spoyling wasting countrie hereby wanne many friendes philip desirous haue peace titus offered vpon condition would greece libertie city greece yeelded tit remoue garisons citie philip refused thereupon greece came offered themselues vnto titus without compulsion nowe hauing greece side went towardes thessalie great hope ouercome philip titus armie sixe twentie thousande fighting men plutarch writeth king philip side lesse number beganne march one towardes neere citie scotusa determined trie battell titus gaue ouerthrow slue eight thousand philip battell scotusa lost philadelphus adicted peace warre giuē book brawles tooke greater care furnish egypt lawes ordinance iewes prouide preparation antiochus therefore auoyde warre whereby might finish many good thing philadelphus died sonne ptolomey euergetes succeeded thought reuenge murthering sister made great armie readie giue battel seleucus tooke part syria wasting spoyling sedition great mutinie egypt asia beside hearing sedition mutinie egypt kingdom returned hauing done great harme seleucus answere rebelled egypt meane season seleucus thoght recouer losse ptol euergetes also requite like litle stay seleucus came nomber nauies thought diod lib 18 haue againe townes city lost ptolomey sudden tempest ouerwhelmed enterprise left nothing seleucus al preparation nudum corpus spiritum himselfe others frō shipwracke staied repulse could reuenge wrōg ptolomey vntil saw time conuenient time man borne ouerthrowen fled battell losse shame antioch thence sent ayde brother antiochus silicia ptolomey vnderstanding antiochus ayd presently concluded peace betwene seleucus ptolomey peace betweene seleucus himselfe 10 yeeres antiochus perceiued matter went came ayd brother turneth force power brother hauing many celtes frēchmen hired souldiers ouer brennus charge brēnus sackt rome 108 yeres brennus gaue ouerthrow brother seleucus met againe eumenes king bythinia saw platforme layd face possesse asia two brother might conquered therefore seleucus ouerthrowen brother antiochus eumenes againe ouerthrew antiochus eumenes ouerthrew antiochus droue asia euen flee ptolomey claptin prison frō secretly stale away fled taken theeues slaine season brother seleucus fall frō horse lost life kingdom raigned king asia syria 20 yeeres two brother discord lost syria asia seleucus came succeeded sonne seleucus ceraunos 5 king asia syria seleucus ceraunos 5 king asia syria raigned 3 yeeres slaine one owne nobleman named nicanor followed antiochus surnamed great 6 king syria indeed great wanne kingdome predecessor hauing antiochus great sixt king syria long warres egypt ptolome philopater greatnes ouerthrow two philopater died left behind young sonne committed safegard kingdome romanes commending sonne minoritie kingdome fidelity senator king distresse fled vnto romanes sanctuary refuge antiochus great minde contemned romanes ieseph lib 7 cap 27 made warres egypt vpon yong king victory romanes ouer hauing something entreated king asia syria yet nothing largely historie required howe king asia syria spoken sacred prophane history haue also intercourse betweene king assyria egypt therefore passe king affrike libya speake warres romanes countrie pomponius mela describeth pompo mela lib 1 east part bounded riuer nilus inclosed north sea libicke south ethiopian sea west antlantike sea affrike shorter europe farre lesser asia length breadth breadth affrike thirteene thousand furlōgs thousand sixe hūdred mile length strabo writeth much againe strabo lib 17 3200 mile part affrike beyond more called nigrites pharusians doe extend ethiope ethiopian possesse thence vnto border asia also white ethiopiās libyaegyptiās dwelling aboue affrica described place recited numidian more whō more extend antlantike sea thinke worke needle describe affrike amplie iulius solinus pōponius mela written latine rest set forth strabo hee writes large note chiefely mine authour 〈1 page missing〉 dearth hapened amongst affricanes roman could longer remaine returned rome victorious nauies great pompe glorie hauing 484 ship sailing braue sort towards rome infinite wealth treasure beholde midst great pompe euents fortune great losse romanes shipwracke great tempest rose suffred shipwracke coast sicile scant saued 80 ship 484 yet inuincible stoute courage romanes mind nothing dismayd missehaps though greatest shipwracke euer romanes nation world new supply captaines straight appointed 260 ship take voyage affrike likewise wonne certaine city townes affrike returned rome great spoile sustained like shipwracke againe senate finding continual danger sailing seafight thought good forsake sea fight vpon land hauing wonne victory foure battels vpon sea infinit came armes owne countrie citie volscans time generall hee great furie inuaded territory rome hee caused communaltie rome nobilitie fall ciuill dissension hee plagued romanes diuers wayes vnto gate haue dealing accompted hanibals saying pyrrhus second souldier world next alexander great like alexander point king discended line achilles named pyrrhus name achilles sonne hee glad haue occasion iupiter liuius lib 7 roman somewhat heated pyrrhus hauing lost two victory prepared thirde battel whose charge giuen curius dentatus consul exspecting ayde come lucania vntill king pyrrhus hot rash captaine set vpon great losse one last ouerthrowes italy find eutropius pyrrhus romanes victorie ouer pyrrhus lost twentie thousande souldiers elephant himselfe sore wounded pyrrhus hauing repulse rome romane souldiers soone conquer asia europe fabritius noble romane sent king pyrrhus fabritius honoured rome esteemed abroade yet poore man pyrrhus offered gold reade polibeus warre lib 2 siluer yea fourth part kingdome hee would forsake rome fabritius refused pyrrhus gift also opened treason conspiracie phisition offred money bring pyrrhus fabritius hand hee forced pyrrhus flee sicilia hee subdued samnits lucanes hee triumph graunted pyrrhus stayed musing sicilia curius dentatus cornelius lentulus consul sent meete pyrrhus giue battel romanes suffered haue rest within italy battell alexander roman concluded peace affricanes also time rest warre nation thing happened since building rome vntill time numna pompilius raigne long lucius posthumius albinus consul warre begunne betwixt illyrian romanes ouer whome taken many city triumphed illyrian yeelded time frenchman inuaded italy armie eight hundreth thousand ouerthrowen aemilius consul 40 thousand enemy slaine triumph eutrop brought rome exceeding great spoile plutarch marcel istrians ligurians also within subdued romanes time tenca queene illyrian slewe romane ambassadours lawe romane ambassadour slaine tenca armes time carthagineans gotten strength made themselues readie reuenge great loss wrong sustained first warres romanes second warres hanibal sonne hamilcar age 20 yeeres made generall father first presently great furie beganne lay siege saguntum famished thence passed ouer alpes brought italy 80 thousand footemen 20 thousand horseman conueyed armie riuer ticium pub cornelius scipio consul discomfited ticium armie slaine scattered himselfe wounded welnigh taken sonne scipio afterward called affricanus rescued hanibal passed still forwarde armie camped riuer trebea hee gaue like ouerthrowe polibeus lib 3 sempronius gracchus consul thence hanibal passed hetruria time great tempest much hindered wounded battell trebea eye mischaunce lost hee marched placentia flaminius consul slaine hanibal great battell hee slewe caius flaminius consul 25 thousande souldiers hanibal thus heated good successe victory passed vnto apulia gaue greatest ouerthrow roman euer eutrop lib 3 battell cannes time lucius aemilius pub terentius varro consul battell aemilius consul slaine twentie order consul praetor 30 slaine taken senator liui lib 22 infinit nomber noble men gentleman souldiers florus lib 2 layd downe particularly warres affrike battel made italy quake many city countreys part italy reuolted romanes reuolt roman capua campania place written hanibal time send carthage three bushel full ring iewels howbeit asdrubal hanibals second brother like lucke spaine hanibal italy hee lost time men thirtie fiue thousand two scipio spaine captaines romanes victory scipio spaine ouer asdrubal mago within asdrubal seconde brother mago thirde brother hanibal second time ouercome two scipio againe spaine time hanibal played lion italy taken many city romanes apulia calabria yet romanes foure seuerall place one time foure generall lieutenant armes 1 macedonia valerius liuius philip 2 titus manlius torquatus sardinia sardinian 3 pub cor scipio spaine asdrubal 4 italy hanibal furie hanibal continued italy tenne yeeres italy stoode dispaire themselues fabius max sent hanibal hee detracting time delayes hindered violence rage hanibal cunctando •… restituit thereby finding oportunitie set vpon hanibal gaue tentimes ouerthrowe therefore hee called scutum romanum romane targat onely delayes euen fabius target rome marcellus heate furie called ensis romanus likened hanibal himselfe hanibal himselfe called marcellus sworde rome marcellus romane hanibal said marcellus neither quiet conquerour conquered violence hanibal continued italy tenth yeere hee inuaded italy many victory ouer romanes hee approched within foure mile rome horseman came gate citie time encrease fame brother asdrubal slewe pub scipio cneus scipio scipio spaine great discomfort rome many yeeres bene conquerours spaine hanibal might haue easily conquered rome hee set forwarde armie caesar saide afterward hee feared consul readie come rome giue battell without good cause hanibal found many scipio many fabius many marcellus hanibal droupt many hanibals like himselfe hee still stoode awe romanes heard scipio went spaine place two scipio slaine asdrubal also heard victory ouer many city shortly heard carthage spaine warres hee tooke mago hanibals brother sent residue prisoner rome daunted courage hanibal augmented glorie scipio age twentie foure yeeres whose going spaine fortune hanibal declined italy fabius maximus recouered tarentum tarentum recouered fabius max many city yeelded hanibal submitted themselues fabius marcellus also recouered salopia taken syracusa many city campania sundrie time scattered hanibal armie canusium either two consul fabius marcellus bene twise dictator fiue time consul spaine also pub scipio gaue ouerthrowe asdrubal betula slewe eight thousande affricanes spaniard pub scipio eleuenth yeere warre beganne marcellus noble captaine hanibal feared slaine venusia consul hanibal honourablie consul marcellus slaine caused buried venusia hanibal flourished victory italy scipio excelled spaine victory hee discomfited king spaine atchieued great conquest time hanibal sent brother asdrubal come spaine italy preuented set purpose asdrubal hanibals brother slaine way slaine armie appius claudius nero time fiftie sixe thousande slaine asdrubals head brought throwen tent hanibal brother hanibal beganne dispaire successe warre spaine affrica hee meanes weakened italy reuerted slid hanibal scipio subdued carthagineans tooke syphax king scipio tooke syphax king numidia numidia prisoner ioyned ayde affricanes romanes also expelled warre masinissa kingdome great ouerthrowe spaine affrike caused hanibal quake italy hee beganne forsaken former fortune affrike cried ayde writer make mention second punicke warre hanibals hand hanibal perceiuing went decay also sore wearied continuall battels desired peace graunted vpon straite hard condition pleased carthagineans therefore willed hanibal rather fight last battell whereupon whole state affrike depended appointed fought zama two great captaines ioyne battell hanibal desired speake scipio openly priuately scipio denied meeting hanibal sight army speach hanibal tendred peace scipio hanibal scipio talke together without accepting condition spoken would allow effect speaches written liuie short battell zama ended scipio cōquered affricanes put hanibal flight affricanes accept condition scipio offered condition peace affricans necessitie sought peace condition peace restore masinissa first kingdome returne romane prisoner italy yeeld ship sauing tenne deliuer elephant hand conquerour make warre within affrica without without licence senator rome yeerely reuenues affrike romanes yeerely reuenues 10 thousand talent siluer payed romanes warre finished peace thus concluded scipio receiued vnto rome great triumph hauing sirname giuen conquest affrica called scipio affricanus others serued second warre affrica triumphed meane dictator consul praetor romane magistrate captaines haue layed downe viewe name together order serued fielde publius cornelius scipio titus sempronius quintus flaminius triumphed great pompe rome sauing fewe slaine warres lucius aemilius affrike endured eutropius saith 19 yeres fame romanes ouerthrow hanibal others say 17 yeeres warre romanes waxed strong soone conquered al nation presently ensued warre macedonia king philippe yet macedonia monarchie since time alexander great remained romanes driuen time noble valiant captaine pyrrhus italy nowe pyrrhus haue driuen hanibal scourge italie whippe rome haue also conquered hanibal whip rome stoutest valiantest nation reigned earth carthagineans libyan affricanes terrible warres alexander might compare neither great battels persia subdued darius neither warres india hee looking disposition caesar maried daughter iulia ioyned beginning caesar pompey stood caesar father lawe strong resisted either lucullus crassus pompey onely three bare sway rome caesar came lucullus man rome caesar could abide superiour thus little demaunde made caesar become consul rome great seruice fraunce place denied marcellus consul meanes pompey grewe great cause ciuill war betweene pompey secretly night escaped caesar fled eutro lib 7 citizen yeelded caesar marched rome without resistance entred senate opened cause comming silla marius destroy countrie iu caesar request vnto senator senator haue caesar dictator caesar absent spaine caesar returne rome made himselfe consul scruilius ismaricus consul committed italie rome caesar tooke sea sailed pompey epirus thence dyrachium celius milo began quarell make sedition consul seruilius slaine pompey thus discomfited plut alex fled alexandria thought haue certaine aide king egypt ouer whō pompey appointed tutor senate minoritie king pompey deceiued expectatiō killed head cutte sent caesar egypt eutrop lib 6 caesar sawe hee wept see head worthie man pompey melancthon sayeth pompey slaine pompey slaine egypt melancthon chron lib 2 great battelfoure yeres father ouerthrowen pharsalia slaine spaine sonne pompey called sextus pompeius liued eight yeres caesar slaine long pompeis death caesar came alexandria pompeis sonne slaine affrica certaine conspired death aduise ptolome caesar hereupon made warres vpon king hee ouercame put flight drowned himselfe riuer nilus melanct saith men achillas photinus septimius slue pompey conspired caesar vnderstanding commaunded slaine king feare also caesar fled amōgst others drowned seeking escape egypt giuē caesar cleopatra king sister caesar sonne cleopatra called caesarion hee vsed paramour returned egypt pompeis friend fled affrica caesar sharpe warres doubtfull battels last battel fought munda pompeis sonne caesar driuen neere straight men fled thirtie thousand melanct lib 2 chron slaine caesar thought slay himselfe cato scipio afranius portreius fought desperatly feared danger yet caesar gote victorie scipio stocke scipio affricanus father lawe pompey slue himselfe cato petreius lu florus lib 4 iuba king mauritania quintus varus pompeis lieutenant lu cornelius faustus sillas sonne dictator afranius cneus pompeius eldest sōne pompey great slaine battel caesar affrike warres marcus antonius made dictator rome chap vii alteration change common wealth rome aristocratia monarchia againe king consul nowe consul emperours state altered iu caesar first emperour last dictator rome iu caesar vnto ende nero last progenie augustus pompeis friendes adherent thus subdued ciuill warres cleare appeased caesar returned rome great triumph chosen perpetuall dictator named people emperour hee vsed great clemencie towards pompeis friend caused pompeis image throwen humanitie great courtesie caesar downe set vp againe hee raised child parent slaine ciuil warres betweene silla marius therefore romanes dedicated temple clemencie caesar courtesie caesar idle ciuill warres many daungerous battels october hee entred triumph rome time reformed inequalitie yeere brought perfection kalender caesar pleased rome without regard senator consul onely cause cassius brutus conspiracie yet caesar saued brutus life twise pompeis death conspiracie concluded conspiracie caesar brutus cassius betweene brutus cassius many senator gentleman rome time appointed place diuerse strange impression seene ayre also strange markes founde caesar gouerne romane empire presently obtained empire carinus numerianus two caesar eutrop lib 9 made 2 sonnes carinus numerianus caesar commenced warre persian againe probus thought died haue taken hand kind mischiefe vntill ouerthrowne dioclesian emperour next succeeded father carus time rome great trouble empire great danger time magistrate noble men flourished became emperor patrenus volisianus monument rome olde rome hereby defaced new rome thereby flourished empire deuided betweene two emperours one constantinople rome nowe dioclesianus beganne reigne carus augustus dioclesia 38 emperour stricken lightning sonne numerianus slaine treason created augustus borne dalmatia scriueners sonne eutropius saith others affirme bondman amulinus senator emperour assoone obtained empire hande reade scattered taking rome possessed many place asia europe named according place dwelt gallogreeks called mingled greek dwelling diuers partes greece greece brought al asia much europe afraid spoiling robbing kingdom countreis came long time plagued thē seemed lord al place beyng hardy rude barbarous people able suffer anie diod lib 5 hardnes apparelled skinnes beast lying vpon ground shamelesse part asia frenchman otherwise called gallograecians flourishing many place romanes eye vnto fearing put greater force sent cneius manlius consul war vpon gallograecians terrible battel mount olympus order hildegastus man great fame amongst frenchman time hildericus kingdome persia beganne againe vnder artaxerxes slue time artabanus king parthian hee first king persia since conquest darius codomanus alexander great sixe hundred yeeres rome time reigned emperour alexander seuerus whose dayes citie rome florished wise men learned knowledge hildericus sonne named batharus 15 king batherus reigned eighteene yeeres time reigned rome idle lasciuious emperour gallienus hee carelesse empire thereby oportunitie giuen batherus euer lay watch predecessours annoy romanes subdue gaules hee say brought armie souldiers italie ayded germanes beganne thirst empire rome dayly fell time declining state batherus spoyled wasted countrie italie itale spoyled sword vnto rauenna sworde fire vntill rauenna hauing done much harme hee returned backe countrie great spoyle returne italie leauied armie saxon germanes passed riuers rhene mosa mosa entred gallia hee made great slaughter gaules subdued gallia vnto riuer sequana called sene thence confines spaine ouerthrowe romanes gaules thirteenth yeere batherus reigne liued fiue yeeres dyed whome succeeded clodius eldest clodius king farabertus sonne batherus reigned king ouer frenchman twentie seuen yeres time reigned rome thus many emperor aurelianus reigned 6 yeeres annius tacitus florianus brother aurelius probus foure emperours reigned great 185 yeeres thirtie three king elidurus vntill belinus great 185 belinus vncle vnto cassibelane reigned king britaine iulius caesar came britaine thousand thirtie yeeres brutus long britaine vnconquered said spite androgeus cassibelan wrote letter caesar first great ouerthrowe caesar lucan poet saith territa quaesitis ostendunt terga britannis romani c androgeus duke troinouant nowe called london androgeus onely cause caesar victorie since king luds time promised aide helpe britaines coulde make conquest caesar restored gouerne britaines caesar meanes brought britaines paye tribute romanes yet reigned king britaine cassibelan lineally vnto cadwallader seuen hundred yeres odde king britaine continued 1800 yeeres britaine gouerned first king vnto last thousand eight stock proceeded frō gen iulia gouernments neede write herein desire lesse satisfie reason authority bee satisfied coruinus learned romane orator willing please augustus caesar setting foorth familie house proouing gen iulia stocke first emperour iulius caesar vncle descende lineally ascanius historie written coruinus de progenie augusti whose time coruinus florished whome augustus desired traueile set august caesar desirous knowe genealogie downe genealogie stocke fortunate emperour hee subduing almost kingdomes worlde captiuating prouinces vnder empire rome hee might knowe also whence gen iulia came hee might assure selfe certeintie house satisfie emperor augustus thereunto intreated coruinus briefely diuided whole earth three seuerall partes asia europe affrike asia great asia lesse conteyned countrie region named phrygia one dardanus great prince creete daughter one teucer giuen dardanus married daugh ter teucer mariage came great multitude young men souldiers inhabite time moses dyed hee builded great citie named owne name dardania inhabitant therein called dardanian fame king dardanus grewe great teucer father lawe came creete number gentleman visite daughter vnto dardania phrygia dardanus reigned three yeres succeeded ericthonius succession king reigned troy 75 yeres ericthonius succeded tros king dardania reigned sixtie yeres dardania named troy king name tros succeeded ilus reigned 54 yeres succeeded laomedon reigned 36 yeres reigned sonne priamus named dionys halicar lib 2 alexander history sixt last king troy whose time troy destroyed grecian messala setteth downe historie aeneas warres came italie maried king latinus daughter succeeded heire aeneas maried latinus daugh ter king kingdom whose body lineally descēded many king whose name emperours romanes frenchman owne best writer proued aemilius writes antiquitie likely euery countrie hath care selfe country rather french writer beleeued history fraunce forreigne writer romanes grecian country myrsillus saith plus vicinis quàm remotis multò plus genti ipsi quàm extremis credatur yet seeth romanes grecian frenchman nation aduaunce country best history passe diodor lib 2 lightly ouer many history make country diodorus siculus describeth britaine name britaine fertill plentifull corne cattell iron diuers commodity doeth strabo commende britaines bee people farre bigger taller frenchman wordes britannorum statura supra strab lib 4 gallos procera c reporteth certaine britaines himselfe sawe rome time augustus caesar bigger body taller stature romane halfe foote saith strabo vidimus puberes britannos longissimi corporis nostris indigenis semipede celsiores short among iewes permitted talmudistes write countrie history indian talmudists gymnosophist write india olde gaules committed olde recordes chronicle country gymnosophist wise men called druydes olde hispaniards druydes time king long euen vnto romanes time antiquary called turdetani write chronicle turdetani country euen among olde britaines called bardi recorde antiquitie history men like credite estimation among britaines bardi named country without whose consent councell man wrote concerning state antiquitie countrie hee punished according custome countrie easily spoken troy country haue allowed time hath confirmed greeke latine history haue written soone saide brutus continuance time succession king possession countrie doe proue contrary neither geraldus time richard second neither gildas long geraldus liuing time claudius augustus emperour singularly learned neither consent time succession king antiquitie historie affinitie tongue grecian denie holde auncient name riuers townes mountaines monument euen brutus time selfe tongue brutus spake let giue credite pont varunnius iulius caesar said gen ex nostra prosapia est proued coruinus halicarnassaeus lineally descend aeneas shoulde write inuidia serra animae truely spoken three good vertuous mother three wicked vicious
